text: Frisch gezapft. Klar und bernsteinfarben mit mittelgrißer Schaumkrone. Malzig. Leichter Körper. Spritzig.
Cask at the brewpub in Dusseldorf. Quite pale for an alt. Amber with a foamy cream head. Mild toast aroma. Toast flavor. Moderately bitter finish. OK.
Klares Bernstein mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, etwas Karamell, leicht fruchtig, würzig, leicht bitter.

several 0.2 l draught @ Brauerei Schumacher (Apr 21, 2017). Appearance is amber, clear and with a nice head. Taste has hops and fruits - similar to a very goood real ale bitter. Taste gets somehow better when the glass is near finished. This phenomena happened with every new glass.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2017 1l Bottle. Hazy dark amber color with eggshell head. Aroma is toffee, caramel, bready, floral, nutty. Taste is toffee, caramel, nutty, with a slightly bitter finish that is a touch metallic. Medium carbonation. Very nice!
Had on a recent trip to Dusseldorf, malty, hoppy and undecided if this was the best alt I had that day.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2017 1 l Flasche. Aroma: malzig, Röstaroma, metallisch. Erscheinung: dunkles Bernstein, cremeweißer, feinporiger, stabiler Schaum, sehr schöne Gardine. Geschmack: malzig süß, Röstaroma, angenehm bitter. Nachgeschmack: recht vollmundig, weich, lange anhaltende Bitterkeit. Gesamt: leckeres Alt.

1L bottle from trade with Erzengel. Many thanks! Pours a hazy chestnut dark brown, with large off-white head. Aroma is nutty caramel. Taste is bittersweet, caramel munich malts, floral spice with a herbal bitter hop bite. 2 months past the drink-by date, despite being bottled 3 months ago, and still tasting quite fresh. Great alt.
Draft. Very malty amber Altbier. Roasted malt, caramel, creamy, buttery, some fruit & nut. Tart bitter edge. Well balanced. Malty bitter dry finish. Nice! Very drinkable. (2008)

L:
-pours a clear amber with a medium to big,foamy,offwhite head
-high carbonation visible
S:
-plums,spicy,rose hip,strawberries,biscuity
T:
-hay,earthy,spicy,s bitterniss for the style
-finishes dry
F:
-medium carbonation
-light to medium body
O:
Just a flawless Altbier, lagging a bit behind Ueriges complexity.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2017 Pours a light copper with an off-white head. The aroma is malty (caramel). Medium bod with a light bitterness. Flavors of lightly roasted malt, lightly fruity - apples and pears - with a bitter hoppy finish.
Tap @ Drinkers Pub Eindhoven, medium sample. Clear amber color, short frothy head. Aroma of caramel, bit toast, slight herbal, bit hoppy. Soft sweet in taste, bit bitter. Decent altbier.

On tap at Schumacher Stammhaus. Clear, copper with a medium large, frothy, stable, off-white head. Sweetish-malty, quite grassy aroma of caramel, nuts, some straw and a touch of bread. Sweetish-malty, quite grassy and a little fruity taste of caramel, nuts, straw and a touch of bread, followed by a short, medium bitter, a little dry finish. Thin to medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice!
(On tap) Clear mid brown with big white head. Subtle aroma with notes of bread and toffee. Medium body, medium carbonation. Taste has toffee, yeast and some bitterness. Very drinkable.
Caramel-amber brown color with foam layer. Fresh malty nose. Malty fresh taste with a tiny bitterness. Light bitter yet fresh and malty aftertaste.

#775Many thanks to pivnizub! Díky za kolu altbieru :)Bottle 1l. Clear dark amber body, high light beige head. Aroma of caramel, strawberries, fruits, cereal. Taste is very well balanced between bitter and sweet very slightly sourish aftertaste. Caramel and fruits, mostly plums and dried plums, cherries, wood, touch of strawberries. Light to medium body, medium to high carbonation.Good one.

Bottle 1l, many thanks to pivnizub, zdravím do Bochumi! Clear, amber colored. AROMA- malt, caramel, some strawberries. FLAVOR- neutral to slightly sweet, lightly bitter, smooth, malt, strawberries, some tart berries, touch of caramel and bread crusts. Light to medium bodied. Good.
Aroma is hay, light cereal and roastiness. Taste is low sweetness, not too bitter, floral and light bitterness. Palate is dry. Standard alt, a little bland.
Draught at the brewpub. Clear amber, medium off-white head. Freuity aroma with notes of strawberries, floral hops. Medium bodied, low to medium carbonation. Dry, low to medium bitterness.
Clear amber body with a medium off white head. Aroma is light caramel, malty. Taste is sweet and medium to mild bitter. Watery texture, bitter finish.

F: big, off-white, good retention.
C: coppery, clear.
A: malty, hoppy, caramel, fruity.
T: malt balanced with good grassy bitterness, caramel, yeast, medium body, good carbonation, very good I like this style, on tap in Schumacher brewery in Düsseldorf.

Tap @ Im Golden Kessel, Düsseldorf. Pours a slightly paler dark red brown than Uergies. Large bubbled head with some yellowish brown to it. Aroma is fairly mild. Taste is somewhat fruity, dark malt, slight herbal, light earthiness. Dries up on the finish. Definitely a different take than Uerige.

Draft at the brauhaus. Clear amber brown with a medium off white head. Aroma of malt, bready notes, light caramel and light dark fruits. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Light bodied with light carbonation. Quite enjoyed this one, my favourite alt of my visit to Düsseldorf.
cask @ the brewery. Clear amber with white head. Malt aroma. Sweet malt aroma, caramel, watery

Tap (Schumacher, Dusseldorf)
Mahogany, large bready head. Head tastes utterly delicious, Super fruity aroma. Refreshing palate. Amazingly fruity taste, nutty too, a bit woody. Absolutely lovely brew, attenuation perfect, hopping gently metallic and vapoury in the finish, some dry nuttiness too. Makes you want another one, which is the best thing a beer can do.

Sehr "kölsches" Alt. Verhältnismäßig mild, sehr ausgewogen. Leichte Süße und Karamell, zudem feine Hopfenbittere, nicht zu stark. 
Süffig!

(Flasche) Es hat eine bräunliche bis kupferne Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist Puddingplunda, leicht metallisch und süßlich. Der Geschmack ist wie das Aroma nur leicht pappig. Die bittere ist grün.

1l Swing Top Bottle. Krachla wystrzelila chucznie i ze sporym dymkiem. Piwo już od samego początku ma wyczywalny chmielowy aromat. W smaku dominuje goryczka która osiada na dalszej części podniebienia, nasuwają mi się skojarzenia z herbata, jakimiś ziolami oraz oczywiście niewielka slodowoscia jak na altbier. Troche karmelu i miodu ale niewiele bo zdominowal te wrazenia chmiel i bardzo przyjemnie ciagnacy się goryczkowy finisz. Polecam te klasykę.

Bottle, thanks Erzengel, big long lasting bubbly head, hazy dark orange to red color, light malty aroma with just a spicy hint, malty caramely flavor ith a medium strong herbal bitterness, medium bodied and quite smooth. Nice and pleasant to drink.
1l Flasche. Rotgold- kastanienfarben. Kräftiges Malzaroma. Nicht zu süß. Malzig herb. Tolles Alt.
Schöne Farbe ordentlicher Schaum, malziger fruchtiger Geruch, leichte röstaromen und malziger im Geschmack
Saazer type hops, toasty malt in the aroma. Medium high bitterness with a somewhat astringent hop flavor. Dry finish

hellbraun bis kupferfarben mit weißem Schaum 
schöne Röstaromen mit angenehmer Bitternote

1000 ml bottle. BB 29/07/15. At the Kahdet Kasvot, Tampere, Finland.
Clear copper color with a small light tan head.
Dry malt, mild metal, mild hops and some sweetness in the aroma. 
The flavor is great with malt, sweetness, dry hops and mild fruitiness. Tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at Schumacher Im Goldenen Kessel. Clear amber color, good creamy beige head, lace. Nutty, grassy aroma. Light-bodied. Nutty, some Caramalt and then nice spicey hoppyness in the finish. Fresh alt!

Well, I suppose if I wrote comments about Alt-Bier from Duesseldorf, they wouldnt be neutral. I just love the Alt-Bier from Duesseldorf. They are simply next to none. So, I judge all the beers from "Altstadt Duesseldorf" equally.
Tap at the bar and on the Brewery, 3rd June 15. Light in colour, lighter in flavour than others, taste is weak toffee, some slight banana. Easy to swill

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2015 The beer has a beautiful dark amber color and a slightly of-white layer of rough foam. The beer is crystal clear. The beer has a fresh smell. It has a nice amount of bitterness and a spicy touch. There is also a tiny refreshing sourness in the smell. The taste is equally nice. There is a nice little hoppy taste on the back of the tongue. Overall the beer has a lot bitternes. The beer gives a nice tingling sensation in the mouth. Really nice beer, I am gratefull i had the opportunity to try this one.

Bottle at thepeters leaving drinks. It pours clear deep amber with a decent off-white head. The nose is earthy, rich malts, wood, leather, toasty brown bread and cereal. The taste is lightly bitter, toasty, bready malts, cereal, toasty grain, touch of grass, wood and light caramel with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Smooth, balanced and very drinkable. Easy going alt.

From the barrel at the source. Pours a clear, brilliant light amber with a tan head. The smell is roasted malt, licorice, herbs. The taste is roasted malt, herbs, crisp with a bit of sweetness to balance it. Light+ in body with nice fine carbonation.
On tap at the Brewpub. Clear dark amber with a medium head. Aroma and taste of malt, some bread, light hops and a touch of caramel. The finish was medium bitter and on the dry side.

1 l bottle
Appearance: Dark brown color and a frothy 2 fingers sized head which lasts and leaves lacing. Full points for that one.
Aroma: Lightsour, fresh yeast, bread malts and caramel, Some earthy tones and hints of banana.
Taste: Is below moderate seeet and quite dry, decent bitterness. Tate is bready malts, some caramel,some toasted malts, grainy bread,with a trace of banana. Good bitter finish. Bready aftertaste.
Slick texture, creamy foam, medium body and average carbonation.

Good Altbeer, no tricks just pure refinement and cratmanship put this miles ahead of the big brewery supermarket stuff and clearly worth a drive to Dusseldorf if your 1,5 hour away. (The Autobahn is nice !)
with yves at his home 1l bottle dark amber coloured body with an off white head and a malt hops aroma a malt hops bitter sweet taste with a bitter finish
Shared with wim at my home. Clear dark amber colored beer with small white head and only few carbonation. Malty fruited aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is sweet dry bit bitter rather bitter.

From Keg.

Has a dark brown color, with ruby red hints to it, and a froth, generous head.

Smells of slightly sour, fresh yeast, rustic bread malts and toffee hints, resulting into a slightly sweeter malt body, which overall still appears to be very earthy.

Tastes dryer than expected, with a decent bitterness, coating up the bready, toasted malts. Malts then turn even more present, introducing a caramelized aspect to the palate, still carried by a grainy bread foundation. Returning with with a slick aspect to it, the bitterness shines again during the finsih, supported by a well fitting carbonation, while there is almost no sweetness left, leading to a well balanced finish.

Trade with McTapps. 
Couleur cuivrée, bonne mousse un peu beige. Nez leger caramel. Gout malté,herbe sèche, amertume tannique, note salée. Longue amertume en fin de bouche.

Bottle 1L kindly shared by Calisky. A clear amber beer with low head and poor retention. Nose is malty, toasted caramel, bit spicy. Aroma is on dry caramel and toasted caramel, grassy hops, almond, body is a bit low. Finish is long on toasted caramel, and grassy bitterness.

Appearance: Dark amber brown, clear. Some off-white head.
Aroma: Malt, caramel.
Taste: Nice malt, caramel, nutty, smooth. Like it!
Bought: Trade with Erzengel - thanks!, 1000 ml
Info: 27/11-2014, BB: 10/11-2014

On tap @ Schumacher. Clear copper with a small off-white head and good lacing. Aroma is mild with caramel, earthy notes, toasted malt and grains. Taste is similar with caramel, toasted malt, grains and light earthy presence. Light body. Moderate carbonation. Very short aftertaste. Quite drinkable, but a tad bland. Decent/good.

Clear amber-brown and thick off-white head. Aroma is hay, light cereal and roastiness. Taste is low sweetness, not too bitter, floral and light bitterness. Palate is dry. Standard alt, a little bland.

Unassuming smell, clear deep amber in colour with a bitter two-finger layer of cream-yellow foam. The taste is that of a more mature, possibly wood-aged altbier; nutty with notes of deciduous forest, campfires and caramel. High standard altbier.

Sample at Great British Beer Festival 2014, London. Clear golden/copper beer with a small offwhite head. Fruity hop aroma, grassy, caramel, bread notes. Fruity hop flavor, citrus, hay, some biscuits. Maybe not your typical altbier, but kinda drinkable.
Pretty standard altbier with some faint caramel notes and a soft, light body. Very drinkable and refreshing.

Classic Alt from a one litre bottle. Creamy, yellowish white, pretty stable head, attractive pale amber, orange colour. Strong nutty and caramelly malts, soft and rounded, nicely perfumed with dried fruits and spicy German hops; firm finish, bit toasted with long, hop bitter finish.
1L bottle thanks to Erzengel. Thanks! Color is copper to red. Head is thin to medium. Taste is medium bitter, medium sweet. Aroma is fruity, caramel, malt, dried fruits.

Bottle: Dark Cooper color. Aroma is malty, toasty with notes oft roasted malt, molasse, toffee, bitter hops. Flavor is also malty, nutty with toffee notes, roasted malt, caramel and light herbal bitter hops. Really good.

Bottle shared with McTapps & MichaelAwesome. Pours slightly hazy amber with small white head. Dusty aroma with malty and hoppy notes and touches of yeast. Bitter, hoppy flavour, with dusty notes and touches of malt, yeast and raisins. Lingering, bitter aftertaste with touches of yeast and a little metal. A good Altbier, indeed.

On "tap" at Butchers Tears from a 5L mini-keg. Clear deep amber colour, soapy off-white head. Aroma is very sweet, syrup, lemonade, caramel, malts, some leafy stuff. Flavour is sweet, malty, caramel, leafy hops, grain, nice bitter finish. Light-bodied. Probably not in excellent condition, but still a nice beer.

On tap at Im Goldenen Kessel. Good appearance, nice clear copper, super forthy lacy off white head. Aroma is toasty, grainy, light hay-like notes, kind of hoppy, light caramel. Taste is bitter, hoppy (for an alt) light burnt toffee, tasty. Palate is light-med bodied, smooth light carb, dry. Very nice.

Bottle sample at Beer and Beyond shop. Thanks DSG.Clear bronze-brown with a quick dissolving white head. Full, grainy aroma. Fresh, bitter taste, very grainy with apparent hops. Light body, carbonated, long-grainy aftertaste. Really good.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer and Beyond shop. Thanks DSG. Pours orange rusty with a small head, aroma of malt, vanilla, caramel and floral tones, flavor of malt, vanilla, fruits and floral notes, some bitterness, medium bodied.

Bottle shared at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Erzengel for this bottle! Two weeks old bottle. Nice clear reddish amber with a beige head. Aroma of malt, nuts, mild fruitiness, some toast and mild noble hops. Sweetish flavor with malt, toast, mild fruitiness, a nutty note and a rather bitter finish of spicy and herbal noble hops. Medium-bodied. Nice and refreshing.

Out of the cask at the brewery at Oststr. Malziger Antrunk. Zum Hauptteil recht herb, malzig-trocken. Würzig. Zum Ende hin malzig-trocken mit intensiver alt-typischer Herbe. Aber keinerlei florale Hopfennoten. Auf der Zunge bleibt eine herb-trockene Malznote. Lecker & sehr intensiv malzig-trocken-herb. 13/12/12/13
Medium white to mokka coloured head, clear brown colour, sweet caramel smokey smell, medium carbonation and bitter a bit of coffee caramell liquorise
On tap. Cooper color. The foam remains on the glass while drinking. A roasted malt smell. The taste is bittersweet and lasts shortly.

Appearance: Hazy dense brownish color with a off white head.Aroma: Fruity, malty and some herbs.Palate: Medium + body. Slightly sweet and a mild bitterness. Average to soft carbonation.Taste: Fruity, malty, nutty and herbal.Overall impression: Nice altbier.Personal stats: Bottle from a trade with McTapps
100cl at Cunningham. Copper coloured with a small, white head. Malty and caramely with hints of herbs. Fairly sweet with a mild bitterness.

Bottle, 1 liter swing top, shared by Cunningham. It pours a big diminishing off-white head over a lightly hazy dark golden body. The aroma has a light caramel and bread touch and a nice grassy hoppyness. The flavor has a fine bitterness to support the bread and caramel. Full body and a soft carbonation. Long malty finish with a fine bitterness. Nice. 140214

Bottle 1000ml @ Cunningham
Pours clear deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel and floral. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long caramel finish. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
Rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, Karamell, bitter. Geschmack röstmalzig, leicht schokoladig, würzig bitterer Abgang.

På fat @ bryggeripuben. Bärnstensfärgad med stort äggvitevispat skum. Dofter av citrus, gröna äpplen och vitt bröd. Smakinslag av karamell, gräs, melon, citrus, röda bär och honung. Gräddig munkänsla. Mycket bra sötma parat med en svag beska.

Per quanto questo stile non possa certo accampare grandi pretese in quanto a gusto e aroma, è fatto bene. Buona maltatura che accompagna per tutta la durata del gusto, finale secco. E che quando bevo questo tipo di birre sembra sempre che manchi qualcosa. Mea culpa, probabilmente.
Draft at Schumacher , Düsseldorf. Clear light brown body with medium white head. Caramel aroma. Light caramel taste, some nuts, some hops. Medium dry finish. Good.

Served in a 200ml glass by an old mean man at the bar. Crystal clear and light brown in color. Large light tan and rocky head, excellent lacing. Medium grassy with some peppery hop nose. Moderate caramel up front immediately followed by a strong hop bitterness that lasts all the way through the finish. Definitely a new experience. Dry finish. Medium to high hop flavor that is all pepper, almost like rye.
großartiges Altbier, sehr süffig, karamellig-malziger Geruch, angenehme Bittere
Nocciola buona schiuma buona persistenza leggero tostature discreta secchezza discreto amaro leggero erbaceo

On tap at the source. tan head that dissipates slowly to the edges and laces. Aroma has lots of bread and leaves notes with a hint of earthy grass. Flavor has bread up front with a bit of a grassy bite and a hint of earthiness.
Tap from the Brewpub,Clear golden amber with nice long lasting head.Sweet,hoppy bitter, roasty malts,spicy,dust, good ballanced and refreshing.

Draft at The Great British Beer Festival 2013. Poured a clear amber colour with a dense off white head. Funky aroma of stale malt and ripe fruit. Malty flavours with cooked fruit and a slightly sour hint. Bitter finish with pine needles and cereal.

Shared a 1l bottle thanks to a friend who brought it from Dusseldorf. Pours a dark amber colour with a tan head. Aroma is malty, caramel and light fruity. Medium carbonation and light body. Flavour starts light sweet caramel changing quickly to a medium bitter and dry end. Nice beer!

GBBF 2013 backlog. TAP.

Head: off-white, medium, creamy to frothy, avg. retention. Color: dark amber, clear. 

Aroma: light, caramel, grassy hops. 

Taste: starts light caramel, finishes dry bitter and clean.
Tap at GBBF 2013. Copper colour loose persistent off white head. Aroma is sweet an malty and some sweaty feet. Flavour is tangy malty
Half pint on tap at the Great British Beer Festival 2013. Amber with a fair head on it. Earthy aroma, a touch metallic. Dry and malty, smooth, its alright.

1L fliptop, big thanks for the logistics to ThirstyBird. Confidently dry and relatively herbal hop-bitter Alt (although alas label also mentions hop extract), ticking all stylistic boxes with ease when this fresh: earthy, non-cloying caramalts joined by tea leaf hop spice to produce a light and easy-drinking, meal-accompanying hearty & spiced roasted thirst quencher at only 4,6% ABV. A true shame that this easy ale style did not survive Prusso-Bavarian bottom-fermenting style imperialism on a supraregional scale and that fully top-fermenting tastiness (not counting Kölsch in this respect) is now confined to Düsseldorf & environs.

Draught at Schumacher, Dusseldorf. Clear amber/brown - offwhite head.
Dark bread. Ok bitterness. Soapy. Dryness. Cocoa notes. Grassy. Nice malt/hop combination.

Draft at Schumacher, May 2013. Brown color again and the same thick, lacing head. Rich malt flavor, and a somewhat oily finish. Good palate. Dryer than  Kurzer, and it doesnt have as much nut character as some of the others.
Draft @ Schumacher. Clear amber small head. Aroma is caramel, fruity and grassy hops. Flavor is malty with some yeast and light spicy hops. Medium body. Solid Alt but there are much better in town.

(on tap) Copper colour, clear, with a small, creamy eggshell-white head. Nutty aroma (walnuts), with resin and toasted notes. Straightforward - not very complex, but still very good. Medium bitterness, very light sweetness. Bitter finish - no long-lasting aftertaste. I would always prefer Uerige, but Schumacher is definitely my second favourite Düsseldorfer Altbier brewer so far.

on tap at the Ferdinand Schumacher brewpub.
Thick creamy white head.  Clear amber pour.  Very good alt beer

1 liter swing top bottle, filled on 22/4/13, good until 22/5/13! Its the first beer I see with such a small time window from production to consumption. Poured into an alt glass. ABV 4.6%
Nice caramel colour on the body, with a thin, one finger tall head, very light beige in colour and soapy. Good retention for its size, left heavy lacing on my glass.
Very nice aroma of light roasted malts, along with some milky chocolate notes combined with noble hops.
Really great taste, very very bitter and the bitterness last for quite long as well. Lots of hops on the taste, with some little caramel on the background.
Medium thick body, quite carbonated. Very dry on the palate, gave me a numb feeling in my mouth. The hops are shining here as well.
Overall, this is until now the best Altbier I had. And a great example as to why you should drink a beer as fresh as possible.

Tap at Schumacher in Goldenen Kessel, Dusseldorf, 28/04/13.
Clear chestnut brown with a decent beige head.
Nose is dark malt, toffee, brown sugars, light fart.
Taste comprises demerara sugars, lightly soured dark fruit notes, dark toffee fudge.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, dryish finish.
Decent enough alt.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Copper body with a thin white head. Aroma is caramel, a bit fruity. Taste is malty, caramel and some toffee. Tasty beer. A bit dry finish.

Draught.
Pours a medium copper with a white head.
Malty aroma, caramel, hops, diacetyl.
Dry, medium bodied, mid bitterness, balanced CO2.
Malty taste, caramel, hops, some diacetyl, earth, lightly roasted. (2013-03-24)
draft at brewery, copper amber pour. nutty, cereal notes in both flavor & aroma. very drinkable/sessionable. nice alt

1L bottle @ Kahdet Kasvot. Rated on 15.04.2011
Aroma has grassy hops, some grainy malt and some nuts. Flavour has bready malt, some grassy notes, nuts and toffee. Refreshing but still rich, I like the hops here.
Clear amber color with white head. Intense malt aroma and nuts. At taste is light sweet pretty balanced with hops. Medium bodied and smooth.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2015 Draught at the brewpub: Proved its class though maybe did not improve. But thats hardly a drawback, given its high level. Nutty, toasted, with a very soft mouthfeel. I got some fruity notes that were flawlessly integrated into the malt profile. Herbal hop finish, seems to be the most bitter out of the traditional Dusseldorf altbiers. Like I wrote before - outstanding.

First rating: Bottle. Really nice, creamy head on top. Ideally harmonic aroma that doesnt need any complexity to impress. Just grassy hops, dried hazelnut and toasted grain that has been kept in a basement for a while. Plain and simple. Soft, velvety mouthfeel, slightly sticky from the full-bodied maltiness, and pleasantly so, wonderfully balanced by a strong bitterness in the flavourful, malty, nutty and hoppy finish. Outstanding!

Bottle shared with McTapps. And what a bottle ! Huge 1,0 Liter pouring in amber to brown with a sweety and malty start but ending up very bitter. After half a glass I had enough as I´m not into a bitter palate. Definitely drinkable and quality but not my fav.
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Deep and clear amber colour with steady and airy head. Taste of caramel, roasted nuts, cereals, grass and bread. Some bitter and metallic finish.

Poured between an ISO glass, a couple of Alt-liek glasses and a Duvel tulip I greedily guzzled the lot. Beautiful read copper colour it has a lusty pure clear sparkle with a thin but lightly fluffy head which clings to the glass but is thinnish in the centre.Theres a rather firm almost dark chocolate whiff about it supported by a nutty background.
Medium bodied at most with a carbonic quality when first in the mouth this is firm, clean and almost delicate. The malt quality is both integrated yet detectable on its own with malt and some fruit at its core surrounded by a firm but restrained bitter edge.
10th August 2012GBBF. Clear dark amber beer, little pale cream coloured head. Smooth semi crisp palate. A little minerals. Okay fresh malt. Not much else to see here.

1 liter bottle as in picuter. Pours clear amber with a two finger white head. Aroma of apples, caramel and malts. Flavour is light sweet and has little body. Really nice session ale during a movie or something. Furthermore nothing special nonetheless..
Its OK, but not the most exciting example of the style. Undemanding. Usual amber coloured ale with hits of malt and caramel.

Amber colour, white head. Aroma of caramel, malts and candy. Malty flavour, caramel, light bitter. Bitter finish, with (surprise!) malts.
Quite unexciting but well-made beer.
(From 1L bottle @ RBBSG II, Wilrijk. Courtesy of ThirstyBird. Thanks Rian!)

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2012 11/VIII/2012 - 1L bottle @ RBBSG - (2012-884) Thanks to Benzai for sharing the bottle!
Clear amber beer, small white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: sweet malts, caramel, toast. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: some toast, caramel, bit nutty, little metallic. Aftertaste: more of the same.

Thx. to Benzai / Rene // swintop bottle sampled @ RBBSG 2012 // clearish amber with a white head // smells of aged caramel, tad bitter grains, grass, yeast, aged candy // bit thinned out with aged age taste, light caramel, spices, yeast, light herbs and mellow malts // tad thinned out body // so/so

Bottle @ RBBSG, Courtesy of Benzai. Amber coloured beer with some very light carbonation and a small white head. Rather sweet malty light herby hinted aroma with the malt being predominant. Medium palate. Finish is grainy sweet malty. Medium.
Bottle courtesy of Benzai, thanks!  Clear amber color. Aroma of subtle caramel. Taste is burnt toast and caramel.  Plain.

Tap @ Schumacher Im Goldenen Kessel. Clear amber with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and light hoppy - straw. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 270712

Bottle sample @ 2nd RBBSG, August 11th 2012. Courtesy of Benzai.
BB 31/08/2012
Ambrée, col beige.
Arôme profile houblonné très allemand, note de malt et fruité léger noir.
Palais malté, caramel retrouve ici le côté typique allemand, léger et fruité, pointe palais pétillant laissant des notes de grains.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2016 Sampled at RBBSG. Clear rusty copper color, small off-white head. Smell malts, hay, straw. Taste malts, cardboard, straw. Quite boring. Too high carbo, low to medium body. Original rating: 5-3-5-2-8=2.3 -- Re-rate November 27th 2016, from tap at Drinkers Pub, Eindhoven. Clear rusty orange color, small white to off-white head. Smell and taste malts, light caramel,  dark caramelised sugar, some bitter, slightly a sweetish hint. Quite nice. Way better than before from bottle.
Roasted malt well balanced by a dry hop finish. Lots of fruity character with plum coming particularly to the fore. Easy drinking, enjoyable beer.
Bottle with swingtop 1ltr: Clear copper coloured brew with good fruity-like bitter taste and some hints of caramel, roasted malts and wood.
Tap in Dusseldorf. Clear, dark orange appearance with a moderate tan head. Somewhat nutty, rich caramel malty, fairly herbal/grassy hoppy aroma. Toasty, rich caramel malty, herbal hoppy flavor.

1000ml bottle. Clear amber colour with average frothy moderatle lacing off-white head. Slightly spicy grainy aroma, bread, some bitter hop. Taste is dry to bitter hoppy, minimally spicy toasted malty, later a touch of sweet caramel malt. Nice carbonation, medium dry finish.
Pours clear and golden orange with a small off white head. Aroma is roasted malty. Slight bitter, caramelish and breadish flavoured. Slight bitter and roasted malty into a dry finish.

Der Körper ist etwas heller als beim Durchschnittsalt, die Schaumkrone hält gut! Geschmacklich röstmalzig und hopfig-herb, lecker aber im Vergleich zu den anderen Düsseldorfer Altbieren gefällt mir es nicht so gut, der Nachgeschmack ist leicht herb und hopfig. Fazit: Trinkbar!
	
Test vom 13.12.2008, Gebinde: Fass 	Noten: 11,9,9,9,-,9 - 9,21

Tap @Brewery. Poured deep amber color with a creamy, lasting white head.Grainy, bready, slightly spicy aroma. Flavor has toasted malt, caramel and bitter hops. Bitter biting finish. Session beer alright.
Tap @ Schumacher Stammhaus and Goldenen Kessel, Dusseldorf. Pours clear amber with a creamy white head. Caramel, a bit of fruit, bread and hops. Smooth malty and dry. Fine.

Bottle @ Kahdet Kasvot, Tampere.
Rated on 20110414.
Pours murky copper color with small head. Aroma of caramel, malts and fruits. Flavor of fruits, malts and dry hay, some yeast also.
3525

On tap at Schumachers brewpub. Amber with a nice creamy off-white head. Aroma of Malt, caramel and some nuts. Nice bitter taste with a malty/caramel ending. Quite nice, the nice place probably gave the beer a extra point, but who cares.
Nice Hoppy altbier.  Delicious caramel notes,  light roast.  Bright amber in color.  Solid,  not my style but I like this a lot.

Bottle, many thanks to pivnizub. Copper color with huge white head. Aroma of caramel and some fruitiness. taste, starts with caramel, roasted malt, roasted malt and than it changes to pleasant bitter hops finish. Well balanced Altbier.

At the Brauhaus, maybe my favourite alt.  Just soo good.  Pours a dark amber with a big frothy white top.  Aroma is grain, cinnamon and german hops.  Taste is a medium to full mouthfeel, rich grainy caramel malt profile with a great hop bitterness in the end.  So fresh, so great.  Im bringing a litre bottle home with me but I know it will pale in comparison to this at the brewery.
Moderate malty aroma. Huge, frothy, off-white head. Excellent lacing. Fully lasting longevity. Clear, orange body. Moderate bitter flavor. Medium palate.

At the brewery, 123 Oststr. Served in a 25cl Altbier tumbler. It may be a small serving, but its sensory delights more than compensate. Brilliant clarity; a little on the light side for typical Altbier, but this is one of the places where the Altbier style was defined! Creamy, long-lasting head. Aroma of resiny, herbal, even a little grassy, hops, hops, hops, with malt right behind. Phenomenal taste: extremely clean bittering, but massive dose of iso-humulone makes its presence felt mid-mouth and even a bit in the back. As in aroma, malt elegantly supports flavor. Finish is dry, and aftertaste is primarily of noble-type hops. A masterpiece!

#4
Eine echte ALT Bier Ikone aus der Düsseldorfer Altstadt, die ihresgleichen sucht! Blank & kupferfarben, hopfig & blumig-malzig im Aroma und dann dieses unglaubliche FRISCHE!! Perliger Antrunk, frisch malziger Geschmack und staubtrocken mit echtem Aromahopfen im Abang! Irresistible stuff!

On draft at the brewery.  Deep amber/copper body is clear with a 2" frothy, off-white head that lasts and looks like a dessert.  Faint, biscuity malt with a low hop presence in the nose.  Flavor is rich and toasty with a bit of a roast flavor.  Faint noble hop spice.  Medium bodied and moderately carbonated.  Fairly bitter, but still with good malt presence.  Bitterness lingers through the finish.  Quite tasty!
super, bardzo dobre,świeże, 30 dni ważności (niepasteryzowane), Bardzo silna goryczka przechodząca w gorzkawy smak w butelkach 1l więc spokojnie można obiecać żonie że wypijemy tylko 2 butelki
Faint aroma of  caramel, amber in appearance.medium sweetness, bitterness and sour.lively on the palate with a bitter finish. A nice beer, but I as expecting more.
Tap at the brewpub in dusseldorf, pretty basic, very light, it had a typical alt flavours but it was pretty faint, kind of leaning on the macro side of things

Ein Altbier aus der 1-Liter-Flasche. Das trinkt man nicht mal eben so. 
Farblich schön in kupfer von dem der Schaum auch etwas mitbekam. 
Geruchlich schwach röstig, dafür mehr fruchtig und säuerlich. Auf der Zunge weinartige und fruchtige Züge zu denen sich ein Aroma nach Korken gesellt (das Bier war doch noch haltbar?!). Holzig - erst im Abgang entwickelt sich eine Bitternote. 
Eigenwilliges und seltsames Alt - nicht so ganz mein Fall.Test vom 14.9.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche
On tap at the brewery. Hazy light brown with little head that retained. Sort of creamy with a lot of dark malts and grass notes. Interesting.
Bottle. Hazy brown colour with large creamy off-white mostly lasting head. Malty aroma and hoppy notes. Spicy bitter flavor

Pours dark copper with thinish head. Nose is sweet malt and fruity hops. Strong taste of toffee malt and fruity hops. Fruity and dryish but thin in the mouth feel. Would prefer more body, as one would get in an English ale.
The body is not up to the level of sweetness in this beer. Schumacher is propably the least interesting of the brews in Düsseldorf Altstadt, although the brewpub itself is rather nice.

Sehr malzig beginnt das Bier, wird aber schnell recht herb, zum Schluss auch unangenehm bitter. Das Bier ist mir zu lasch und könnte ruhig würziger sein, so kommt beim trinken des Liters keine große Freude auf. 	 
Test vom 16.7.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 12,8,10,5,10,8 - 8,35

Thanks to Ethan for this, straight from Dusseldorf... A light clear copper, decent tan head... Aroma is light malt, roast, with a hint chemicals, not a big fan... Taste is light roasted malt... Solid for an alt

One liter swing-top bottle.  Sweet toffee malt and light pepper aroma.  Beautiful clear copper color with giant off-white head.  Lightly sweet toffee malt and moderately bitter dry hay/quinine flavor.  Medium body with a slight metallic aftertaste.  On the light side but pretty good overall.
light malty,light malty,brown golden,clear, light brown,light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation.
Brown and a bit unclear. Has an off-white head, mostly lasting. Aroma has notes of fresh water. Some hoppy notes, faint spicy. Flavor starts moderate sweet and finish moderate bitter, Dry texture.
1 L Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. MOderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Light bitter flavor. Week chocolate notes. Average light bitter finish. Oily palate.
1l bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is dark amber. Aroma and taste are nuts, fruits, malt and hops.
Bottle. Clear amber with big tan head. Flavour is malt, hops, caramel, pine, fruit and grape.

Sligtly less wood character than the most agressive beers in town.
Well balanced. Malty body, dry oak, served the German way, rather flat.
Grapefruit and bitter oranges.
On tap at Schumacher in Düsseldorf. Copper colour and a fine white head. Aroma of malts and light yeast and hops. Flavour has hints of malt and hops, bitter finish.

Cask Stillage at the GBBF, Earls Court 04/08/2010
Floral and malt aromas. Amber coloured fruity and a little rich on the palate with a hint of dryness in a crisp and bitter lasting malt finish.

Bottle. [hanks Feldthaus/Lau]
Pours clear copper with a nice, staying, creamy, yellowish head. Aroma is sweet, malty, a hint of butter and some soft herbal hops. Medium carbonation, nice dry and slight creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is wonderfully fresh, fairly malty, crisp, some caramel. Lovely dry and hoppy finish. Long, lingering, herbal and slightly chalky bitter finish. Nice.
Nice copper colour. A clean and fresh tasting alt with a bittersweet finish.

Bottled. An amber beer with a thick off-white head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel as well as lighter notes of dust. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and caramel and again lighter notes of dusty hops. The body is light.

Draft at Schumacher Stammhaus, Dusseldorf. 
Aroma: caramel, malty.
Taste/palate: A bit too bitter according to the other tastes.
Palate: Light body

A nice surprise was when we smelled that they were boiling wort during our visit in the Biergarten.

An ok Altbier

from Cask @ Brauerei as well as a bottle "for the road." Not as good as it’s brethern in Dusseldorf, still, decent. Pours a copper red with a decent head. Amply lacing. Nose is rather one-sided containing roasted malts and some toffee. Taste has vanilla notes, burnt malts, and some herbal notes. Slight hop finish and a little off balance. Not bad by any means, but nothing to piss in my pants about either.

1l fliptop bottle.
Pours a clear amber with a frothy/laceing vanilla coloured head, which remains filmy after collapseing, carbonations soft.
The smell is of fruits, roasty and hoppy.
The tasteing begins with a sweetness, escorted by a mild mouthfeel, the flavour is dried fruity, the beers body is medium, textures slick and moderate sticky.
In the middle the roasted/caramell malt and the grassy hops coming in front, the finish is spicy, crispy bitter and dry, which remains in a pleasant aftertaste in the mouth.
For me a well drinkable and fine Alt.

Oak cask at the brewery. 
Slightly lighter in color, copper / orange. Tall, fine, foamy head. Aroma of nuts, yeast, and amber malts. A touch sweet, but mostly rather dry and cereal. Sweet and sour flavor with good malt and also good hopping. Not as hoppy as Uerige, but better malt. Hoppier than most other alts, though. Caramel in the background, also a bit of dark fruit. Nutty, and grainy. Very nice. Dry finish of hops and roasted amber malt. Excellent. More of a traditional alt than Uerige, and almost as interesting. Perfectly done.

On draught at the Great British Beer Festival, 3 August 2006. Hazy amber colour. Rather pale for an Altbier. Chewy, slightly musty malt aroma. Sweetish and fruity on the palate. Not a very typical Altbier and nothing too special either.
Clear golden with a large white head. Sweet flavour with malty and caramel notes. Flavour was sweet with malty and caramel notes.

(draught) clear dark amber colour with a ruby tinge and a frothy off-white head. aroma of caramel and pale malts, with some fruity hints of strawberries. flavour is caramel and grainy pale malts, with light and unobtrusive notes of melted butter and a nice lightly bitter herbal hoppy finish. medium body and carbonation.
Bottled 50cl. Courtesy of pivnizub. A top notch Alt. Mindblowingly pleasant. Complex. Faintly salty. A lot better than Uerige Alt. Thanks a lot pivnizub for this gem!
1 liter beugelfles. Het is wel een hele slok zon literfles maar dat is geen straf met zon inhoud. smaakt goed, een mooie volle bier.

1 litre bottle. Reddish brown with a good white head. The aroma is a very malty and sweet. The taste is sweet and malty with a bit of sourness in the middle. Very good balance of flavors. Other flavor notes are caramel, jasmine, vanilla, and even a meaty sweetness. It is clean and smooth and very good.

Draught  Orange-copper, clear beer with small off-white head, fast gone. Fine roasted malts aroma; nice, with a bit of ureum, but very discreet. Roasted malts, toast, with just a touch of hops. Warming up, quite some sulphur. Slight syrupiness, despite fine mineral water quality. Nice, but just to discreetly hopped - certainly in comparison to the Uerige hopexplosion. Then again, their Latzen...

Draught. Medium high creamy and lasting head. Clear amber to brown golden body. Caramel honey aroma. Pretty sharp hops bitterness dominates the flavor, a bit of caramel can be spotted. Low carbonation. Long aftertaste.

Gravity from the wood at brewery and the Altstadt tied house. Pale copper with an off white head. The lightest of the local Alts but just as flavoursome. All the roundedness of a well lagered german beer with the fruitiness of an ale and good fresh ascertive hoppage. An amazing session beer and never to be rated on a sip.

Honey grassy aroma, nice sweet honey malts with a lot of noble hoppy grassy aromas.  Pours golden amber with a thin white head.  Very nicely balanced, caramel malts with loads of grassy hop bitterness, with hints of a nutty flavor as well.  very earthy hop flavor.  A great Altbier!!!!!

Bottled (BBE Apr 2009, from Bov, thank you!). Amber colour, mediumsized beige head, nice lace. Aroma is wooden, a bit fruity with some earth and nutty notes. Flavour is bitter wooden notes along with some nuttyness and caramel malts. Wellbalanced and really nice.

draught at the brewery outlet in Düsseldorf Altstadt - clear copper coloured with a solid persistent beige foam; earthy and nutty aroma, fairly hoppy; respectable malt body and a robust bitterness; long earthy nutty finish, flowery with notes of caramel - wonderful and still deeply enjoyable after many glasses

Bottle 100cl. w. swing top @ [ Ulfborg Tasting ].Clear light to medium orange amber color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, caramel, keller, light hoppy, orange shell. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average duration. Body is medium to light, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20081218]

1 L siphon. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Light spiced and hoppy to roasted malty aroma. Medium sweet malty, light spiced and good roasted base. Ends mild bitter and slight roasted finish.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2010 First ratingDraught at the brewery / brewery outlet in Düsseldorf Altstadt, on December 27, 2008. Clear light brown color, fluffy off-white head. Spicy hoppy scent. Spicy, hoppy, bitter taste. Sprityz mouthfeel, high bitterness.7/4/8/3/13=3.7RerateDraught at Schumacher Stammhaus, on March 13, 2010Clear dark copper color, dense off-white head. Fruity, herbalm hoppy, berry, sweet taste. Fruity, herbal, hoppy scent. Moussy mouthfeel, high dry bitterness. Bitter herbal aftertaste.7/4/8/3/15=3.7

Courtesy of Fonefan, handbottled fresh beer. It is red-golden with a huge, creamy head. The aroma has notes of malt, flower and hints of oranges. The flavour has notes of butterscotch, malt, fruit and hints of oranges. It is an uncomplicated and OK altbier.
The bottle looks simple, but good. The beer in the glass lighter than exspected. Copper-coloured. Starts spicy and strong, modest dry. Finish a bit woody. Very drinkable and good Alt.

One liter fliptop. Copper coloured brew with stable head. Hoppy nose, slight roasted grain smell. Slim malty body, massive hops but a great assembly. Refreshing, longlasting and delicious hop finish. Great brew!

One liter fliptop bottle: poured orange with a large fluffy beige head. Light hop aroma with a bit of malt, light roastiness.   
Mild bitter hop flavor initially, picking up in the finish. Nothing blows me away with this beer.
UPDATED: MAY 25, 2008 On draft at the brewpub. Amber coloured, fair head. Malts and hops, some grainy notes. Dry finish. Not very good, but on the other hand: i had a Schlüssel just before.

One of the less bitter-more drinkable strictly "local" Alts. Amber and somewhat reminiscent of some porters. Joy to find (by far not as big as Diebels or Frankenheim, but luckily a lot more available than Duessel or Schluessel).

From the barrel at Zeitgeist @ The Jolly Gardeners, Lambeth 16/5/08. Deep amber with a slight, off-white head. Aroma of fruity malt, earthy hops and a hint of caramel. Flavour was bitter, with more fruit and grassy hops, some green herbs and a touch of wood, before a light, bitter finish. Enjoyable.

Draught at the Battersea Beer Festival, 7th Feb 2008. Amber with a good head. Aroma is a mix of German hops and wet socks but the flavour is a nice mix of woody and malty notes with some herbs as well. It really fills the mouth and has a long lingering finish. Quite different from other German beers Ive tried. My notes say "German Real Ale?"
Draught at Battersea Beer Festival 8 Feb 08. Golden colored. No head. Modest fruity aroma. Sourish roasted flavor. A dry "heavy" malty aftertaste developing.
Bottle. A decent lt, showing a nice nutty character and some slightly herbal notes. Finish shows some grassy hops in the finish. Drinkable if a little unexciting.

A Mes rate: Bottle at Battersea Beer Festival.Rich amber colour with a good off white head. Nice sweet malt aroma with some lovely herbacious notes but a slightly stale hint is holding it back, possibly a 7. Flavour has a definite chlorine note. Rich malt, lots of herbs, grainy, slightly earthy and sadly a bit of paper. Possible 5. Cant make my mind up about this one. Something I am sure about is that its not outstanding.

Schumacher, Düsseldorf.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, off-white, mostly lasting.
Body is medium to dark amber.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly hoppy (herbs), moderately yeasty (dough).

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter.

Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

The raw yeasty nose really hurts this one.  Not one of the better examples in town, but ok.
From the barrel at the brewpub in Dusseldorf. Very refreshing, with a light bitterness between opening and closing salvos of dry, biscuity malt. Light but flavorful.

Bottle. Noderate bread, moderate hoppy, light sweet. Clear red body, big foamy white head, good lasting. Moderate bitter start, the ending is even more bitter (but nice). Average duration. Medium body, dry texture & soft carbonation. 
A very good Alt.

bottle, traded with Shaney from BTO. Copper colour, large and very persistent head. Very pleasant and promising aroma. The flavour is slightly grainy, pleasantly and intensively hoppy with a touch of roasted malt. Perfectly balanced - a superb Altbier.

Clear copper. Excellenty foamy head looks almost as if it came from nitro. Quite toasty in the nose, rather delicious in fact. Sweeter maltiness than most others, but not forgetting the fresh and profound grainy character. Growing leafiness despite the close to absence of hops in the nose. Foamy, soft palate. I must say I was quite surprised to enjoy this one as much as the classical top 3. Nice finesse.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Aroma is light fruity, herbal, notes of nuts and caramel. Amber color, large beige head, good lace. Light sweet, caramel malts, herbal, bitter hops, hazelnut, hint of vanilla. Medium body, light dry finish. Thanks to DerDoppelbock.
Clear amber beer with a off-white, yellowish head. Very creamy and nicely lasting. Malty aroma and flavors. A bit of tartness. Exactly what I would expect from a beer brewed with only amber malts.

Draught at the brewpub.
Clear amber coloured with a creamy off white head.
Malty aroma of fruits and caramel.
Fruity flavour of malts, caramel and hops.
Dry hoppy finish.

Many happy hours sampling this beer at their Stammhaus in Dusseldorf. My favourite alt of the trip - so drinkable and morish, not as bitter or dark as Uerige and not as light and hoppy as Schlussel, just a happy medium in between. The Stammhaus is also an excellent local compared to the taverns in the Altstadt than can be raucaus and slightly touristy.

Gravity - Beautiful clear red copper body with the creamiest perfect off white head; Super well made clear nose with lots of fruity aromas backed by a balanced amount of malt and noble hop aromas; Soft bitter balanced body with a small very pleasant amount of sharp carbonation; Very long fruity malty bitter fresh finish with green nut and bubblegum aromas. Amazing beer (at an amazing bar)

Tap, march 07. Copper-golden color, crystal clear and a medium white head. Very nice caramel aroma with a touch of seaside saltiness. Slightly phenolic, peachy flavor, sligthly astringent too. Good, but not that great. A nice woody end. Medium MF and a lingering woody aftertaste. Nice but a bit rough alt.
Cask at the brewpub.  Lightly hazy copper colour. Very special estery nose with some sulphur and bubblegum. Dryish with rather clean mouthfeel and light body. Nice salty bitterness.

A comparable tangy orange, sweetly malty/bitter hoppy balance to some of the York brews. Lovely soft cereal-like biscuity afters and lingering hoppy bitterness. Fruity, malty, sweet and bitter. A beautifully rounded example.

aroma: Light honey and biscuit malt aroma
Appearance: Light amber with thick white head that lasts.
Flavour: Dry crisp malt character with low hop flavour or bitterness.
Mouthfeel: Light and fluffy with a rich carbonation. sherryish oxidized character.
Overall: Toasty, biscuity and malty. Balance is between toasty and crisp with a deep drying malt flavours which lingers on the palate.

On tap at Schumacher Stammhaus in Dusseldorf.  Clear, amber body.  Off-white, creamy to rocky head (sounds maybe weird to be aswell rocky as creamy, but it really was: quite steady but with some creaminess, so totally unlike Orval).  Excellent lace.  Ok aroma of citrus, lime, ... with some fine malts.  Nicely balanced flavour: moderately bitter, lightly sweet flavour with a subtle complexity.
Very nice alt, up there with Schlüssel and better than Uerige. Actually the bottle was 2 weeks after expiry date, but I couldnt notice anything wrong.

[big bottle from Tico]
Oxidized candy aroma thats a little nutty plus some German hops.  Chestnut colour, clear and with a lasting bubbly foam top.  Nutty and grainy with malt (?) bitterness.  Sort of sherry-like.  Metallic feel with a bitterness that hangs on for a while.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2007 Draught. Dark red copper colour. Small stable creamy head. Fruity flavour with a bit of sewer. Bad bitterness ruining it for me. Hop aromatic. Too rough. 5 3 4 3 11  
Draught at the brewpub. Weak fruity aroma. Clear dark copper colour. Big, stable light brown head. Clean roasted flavour, a bit fruity. By no means my favourite Alt. 5 3 6 3 12
Very good, not a fan of Alt beers, but this was excellent, sweet and alcoholic. VEry nice foam and good features.
Draught (GBBF 2006): Sweet, very malty with some fresh grain notes. Some raisin like notes in the nose. Amber with a short beige head. Clean, tasty alt.

Aroma is floral/grassy hoppy with some spice and a slight hint of banana. Clear, amber coloured with a brown, thin, lasting head. Taste is quite bitter, caramel malty with grassy hops. Medium bodied. Well brewed alt bier, but 1 liter for two persons is a bit too much of everything.
Draught at GBBF 2006.  Amber with lasting beige head.  Sourish aroma, bit of herb.  Bit woody.  Stale malt.  Lively in mouth.  Bit of apple wood.  Tingly finish.  Odd
100 cl bottle. No yeast at the bottom. Orange little cloudy colour with a nice white head. Aroma of grain, sweet malt and hints of caramel. Very light flavour of soft hops and ends up some bitter.
Draught at Schumacher in Dusseldorf. What a beer! - awesome nutty notes like in a prime English ale with slightly sweet notes but also bitter at the same time. Awesome one, want more!

Draught  GBBF.  A dark copper coloured beer with a tan coloured puddle of a head.  The aroma is dry and nutty and typical of the style.  The taste is dry and nutty, woody and fusty.  A lighter than expected alt on the eye, but otherwise exactly what we would expect.  Pleasant.

At the source in both the Mother-BrewPub and at their location in the Altstadt.

By far the hoppiest Alt in Dusseldorf.  Much more bitter than the rest.

Nice dense head, on the copper beer.  Big bitter hoppy finish with caramel malt flavor.

From the one-liter bottle.  Rich copper pour, with a little more red than brown, clear and inviting, healthy carbonation, with a dense beige head.  In the nose, mild fruitiness (incl. grape) and caramel.  Taste is bitter (much more bitter than, say, Füchschen) and caramelly, dark malts and hops show in the middle.  Long and strong hoppy finish, nice and dry.  Big thanks to MoritzF!

Many an altbier out there that is as good as this. Normal copper color with a nice pillowy head. Lacing was great. Aroma was hard to pick up, but the flavor was not nearly as crisp as a lager should be, some fruit and citrus tones picked up, almost like this one was a bit cider-like. Mouthfeel moderate, on par for the style.

Draught. Bright, orange-copper body with a large frothy off-white head and lacing. The aroma is of malty caramel, bread, and metallic hops. The flavour is somewhat soapy and has metallic mineral notes in addition to a decent hop profile. Finishes toasty and bitter. 

Tried this at the brewpub in on May 26, 2006.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2007 Draft/barrel
Consumed at Schumacher Im Goldenen Kessel, Düsseldorf, June 2006 Tan, toast colored head, clear amber colored body.  Somewhat sweaty celery and toast flavor.  Crisp, moderately hoppy, good, solid sweetness up front, sweeter than most altbier actually, yet has the requisite bitterness that’s expected.  Celery and lactic flavors in the finish.
Copper in color with a medium off white head. Tinny metallic hop aroma and flavor. Bready malt,bitter with a clean finish.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2009 [On tap at brewery] Clear, copper coloured with a large, persistent and fine head. The aroma is light and malty with lots of biscuity, bready notes and and spicey, slightly herbaceous hoppy accents. Light on the palate, more biscuity notes and a dry finish. Very drinkable. One of the best session beers Ive ever had.

This is it, this is the daddy of alt! Draught at the brewpub. We wandered in here whithout any idea of how you order an alt. A german fellow across the bench helped by laying down 2 beer mats which were swiftly filled. Aroma gives you peppery grassy hops, light honey oat bread off the malts. Taste is the perfect balance of all the alts iv tried. Its intresting this is the only place i came back too on all 3 nites. The barman even got to know us, though there are coming on 12 of them each nite. Food is great too. A seriously good beer that one could easily distroy themself on. And well i did. 900th beer too WOO HOO!

(Bottled, "Schumacher Alt Karnevals Sonderabfüllung. Prinz Kay I. Venetia ricarda session 2006", 1.0l, no ABV, no BBE) (Bottled) Clear, dark copper color with a large, bubbly head. Earthy cow-dung aroma. Toffeeish, slightly dry, caramely-malty flavor. Light to medium-bodied, quite soft-carbonated palate. A very basic countryside alt.

Schumacher Altbier pours to a beautiful, bright, deep copper color, with a bright white head and a moderate amount of carbonation. The nose on this beer has some herbal/grassy aroma, but I also get some nice toasty/nutty malt aroma as well. This leads into a very clean, smooth body with good nutty and toasty malt flavor paired with a hint of estery fruit. Schumacher Altbier finishes with more dry maltiness up front, then ends with a pleasing herbal hop bite that lingers. 

Drinking the classic altbiers of Dusseldorf really taught me some valuable lessons. It showed me the subtle differences in a beer style, and range within a beer style. All these altbiers are similar, yet they all have their own unique character that makes them their own beers. Schumacher had a pleasing "dry" malt character that made it different from other alts I tried, and it was a very delicious, drinkable, beer, a perfect one to wrap up a day of drinking in the classic alt houses of Dusseldorf. I really enjoyed this one, and only wish I could have stayed longer and enjoyed more. Schumacher is a must visit for anyone coming to Dusseldorf.

(Bottle 100 cl) Beautiful amber with a fine, dense and very stable head. - a very goodlooking brew. Very roasted, malty flavours with a touch of smoke. Harmonious, balancing bitterness. Very fresh and delicious beer. 260203

Bottle bought at the brewery. Dark copper colour, medium off-white head.
Malty aroma, some traces of hops. Easy to drink, moderate bitter. Dry.

A bit thin considering the style. Dry maltiness, bitter finish with hints of raisins and hops. More fruity than other alts. Good session beer noneoftheless

Bottle: Orangey to amber coloured, huge rocky off-white head; mainly malty nose, some fruitiness and traces of hops; moderate bitter flavour, long, dry and lasting hoppy finish with a tinge of dry maltiness. Highly quaffable, well balanced.

Hop, resin, smoke and citrus aroma; sweetish/very bitter taste with resin, toast and hop aromas; very bitter finsih with resin and hop aromas.
Beautifully hoppy and uncompromisingly bitter.

Clean fresh hop aroma, flowery, light sweet malt behind. Gently yet refreshing and crisp. Gold-amber, just a bit haze, pours creamy white/grey head. Clean, soft, light malty body, gently spice, wall nut, wide bitter palate. Great session alt. Thanks Mr. Shoemaker for sharing with me!

Finally, the beer of my forefathers, and two mothers.
Aroma of mild malts, woodiness also. Slightly opaque copper, pours a large toffee head.  Flavour is a softly fruited malt, with almonds and red plums. Medium, light bodied, pleasantly bitter, very smooth, an ideal session ale. Terrific! The best Alt Ive had.  Many, many Thanks to My Friend Radek. As far as generous gifts go I rated this a 5.1!

Bottled.
Amber, small beige head.
Sweetish, malty nose with some toffee.
Ok bitterness with toffee and some grassiness.

Botled. 
Copper colour. Caramelly nose, also slight bready and maybe chocolate, but only vaguely so. Slight roasty, ashy in flavour. Very fresh feel to it but I cant say I sensed any hop flavour, well apart from the freshness.
Amber coloured. Medium white diminishing head. Grassy, caramel nose. Refreshing flavour. Somewhat hoppy and fruity. Some notes of raspberry. Great bitter finish.

1L Bottle
Mango and melon, herbal (juniper) aroma.
Amber, floating yeas, off-white lacing creamy head.
Roasted and wild honey malt base with juniper and licorice notes on top.
Medium body, mellow mouthfeel. Herbal bitterhop finish. 
Thanks to Dortmunder for this excellent beer.

Clear amber colour with ivory sticky foamy head. Aroma of caramel and malt with some floral hoppy and banana notes. A very gentle, smooth and malty (medium) body is followed by a long lasting banana-fruity and well hopped bitterdry aftertaste. My No. 3 of the great 4 from Düsseldorf.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2013 2013-10-02, from wooden cask, Stammhaus, 7-5-8-3-15=38Beautiful amber color, with dark copper hue, compact head. The aroma is nice, malt, caramel, but also very light cheese. Soft and round mouthfeel, very good malt and caramel flavor, with light residual sweetness, correct bitterness, late roasty touch, and then the final is a bit heavy.Very good.2005-04-04, from wooden cask, Im Goldenen Kessel, Beautiful amber color; nice creamy head. The beer is too cold, as usual in Düsseldorf. The aroma is quite simple (only here a light hoppy note can be detected). There is some malt and a lot of caramel, but its somehow too simple. The final is strong, but there is too much burnt sugar bitterness.

Direct from wooden cask at the brewpub. Copper bronze, excellent white head and gentle natural condition. Good solid hoppiness and caramel/toffee aromas with a faint touch of sulphur. Nice balance of fruity hop and butterscotch in the mouth with some caramel and banana notes developing. Big hop bitter finish with some nuttiness and a lingering suggestion of bananas.

Draught at Schumacher, Im Goldenen Kessel, Altstadt, Dusseldorf. Medium amber colour with excellent white head, that lasted as long as the beer. Malty nutty and hoppy. Very smooth, medium bodied. My least favourite of the Dusseldorf brewpubs Alts, but it is still excellent.

Deep crimson hue with a decent head.  Nutty nose.  Malty accented with nut and fruit and a good balance.  A beer meant to be frunk fresh with just a months life.  One of the best alt biers I have had, it is an excellent example.  Deserves a much high ranking.
From tap: Very fresh and pure taste. Brewed without any antidegradants. One of my favorite beers!

Sweet aroma, malty with light hops. Copper clear with off-white lacing head.  Light body with light carbonation. Starts with light malt and good bitterness. Dry and nutty finish, good bitter through the after. Good bitter altbier.

1 Litre bottle: Pleasant, unssertive Alt. Doesnt set any new standards in any extreme, but very refreshing, thirst quenching. I always think of British real ale when drinking Alt, and this Id order a second pint.

From tap: Light to medium amber colour. Very lacey head, the foam sticked to the glass from top to bottom after I emptied the glass. Flowery, hoppy nose. Normal Alt flavour characteristics, though blander than the other Düsseldorf brewpub Alts. Medium to watery body. Bitter finish. But very easy to drink.

On tap in D'dorf: Served from original wood kegs. What an experience! Didn't quite like the atmosphere of the bar/restaurant though - a little too sterile. Fresh sulfury nose; deep golde amber color; tall, fluffy head. Light malt body, fruity for sure. Light late-arriving bitterness - not nearly as bitter as Füchschen. Creamy mouth feel and smooth. You could drink one of these .2 Liter glasses in about 3 minutes.

As mainstream imo doesn*t mean always bad I will not dump that. Marcipan, sweet malt light nose. Light brown color, little head, but not as nice as the other altbiers. Malty with a bitter nutty kick. Short bitter aftertaste.
a little thin and sweet and the waiters werent very friendly

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2005 Bottle: strong hoparoma with just a bit of licorice. Assertive, herbal hoppy flavor with, again, a hint of licorice. Good maltiness, without being sweet. Excellent altbier, highly underrated.
Brewery tap: Flowery, hoppy flavor. Malty. Hint of fruit in the background. Good but somehow I like the bottled version more.
bright amber -the colour of a glass of black tea. very fruity and not very interesting. heaps of rotting mandarin, banana and melon soaked in caramel. slightly spicy thick finish.

I want to upgrade this beers rating, but I admit to working from memory (not live), so Ill review it at a later stage!
The appearance is everything you would expect from altbier, with a good head of foam.
The aroma is clean altbier.
The flavor and palate are good alt quality, with light body, medium-bitterness and slight hoppiness in the aftertaste, which is quite simply fresh and tasty, excellent session beer, like all real Düsseldorf Hausbrauerei Altbier!  I drank this for years...
UPDATED: MAR 22, 2014 Amber and a bit glowy, aroma is earthy caramel.  Sweet palate, modest caramel with light apple fruitiness and light bitterness. Slightly toasty off-dry finish.
